doc.field: Regional Parcel Dataset (2011) - Seven County Twin Cities Metropolitan Area
Regional Parcel Dataset (2011) - Seven County Twin Cities Metropolitan Area
The Metropolitan Council and the Counties of Anoka, Carver, Dakota, Hennepin, Ramsey, Scott and Washington
The Metropolitan Council and the Counties of Anoka, Carver, Dakota, Hennepin, Ramsey, Scott and Washington
Counties of Anoka, Carver, Dakota, Hennepin, Ramsey, Scott and Washington
Counties of Anoka, Carver, Dakota, Hennepin, Ramsey, Scott and Washington

This dataset is a compilation of tax parcel polygon and point layers from the seven Twin Cities, Minnesota metropolitan area counties of Anoka, Carver, Dakota, Hennepin, Ramsey, Scott and Washington. The seven counties were assembled into a common coordinate system. No attempt has been made to edgematch or rubbersheet between counties. A standard set of attribute fields is included for each county. (See section 5 of the metadata). The attributes are the same for the polygon and points layers. Not all attributes are populated for all counties.
The polygon layer contains one record for each real estate/tax parcel polygon within each county's parcel dataset. Some counties have polygons for each individual condominium, and others do not. (See Completeness in Section 2 of the metadata for more information.) The points layer includes the same attribute fields as the polygon dataset. The points are intended to provide information in situations where multiple tax parcels are represented by a single polygon. The primary example of this is the condominium, though some counties stacked polygons for condos. Condominiums, by definition, are legally owned as individual, taxed real estate units. Records for condominiums may not show up in the polygon dataset. The points for the point dataset often will be randomly placed or stacked within the parcel polygon with which they are associated.
The polygon layer is broken into individual county shape files. The points layer is provided as both individual county files and as one file for the entire metro area.
In many places a one-to-one relationship does not exist between these parcel polygons or points and the actual buildings or occupancy units that lie within them. There may be many buildings on one parcel and there may be many occupancy units (e.g. apartments, stores or offices) within each building. Additionally, no information exists within this dataset about residents of parcels. Parcel owner and taxpayer information exists for many, but not all counties.
Polygon and point counts for each county are as follows (based on the January 2012 dataset unless otherwise noted):
polygons / points Anoka - 129385 / 129385 Carver - 38699 / 38699 Dakota - 136792 / 150666 Hennepin - 424702 / 424702 Ramsey - 148978 / 166846 Scott - 55227 / 55227 Washington - 106841 / 106841
This is a MetroGIS Regionally Endorsed dataset. (See http://www.metrogis.org/data/about/index.shtml#whatis for more information.)
Each of the seven Metro Area counties has entered into a multiparty agreement with the Metropolitan Council to assemble and distribute the parcel data for each county as a regional (seven county) parcel dataset.
Additional information may be available in the individual metadata for each county at the links listed below. Also, any questions or comments about suspected errors or omissions in this dataset can be addressed to the contact person listed in the individual county metadata.
Anoka = http://www.datafinder.org/metadata/anok_parcels.htm
Carver = http://www.datafinder.org/metadata/carv_parcels.htm
Dakota = http://www.datafinder.org/metadata/dako_parcels.htm
Hennepin = http://www.datafinder.org/metadata/henn_parcels.htm
Ramsey = http://www.datafinder.org/metadata/rams_parcelregions.htm
Scott = http://www.datafinder.org/metadata/scot_parcels.htm
Washington = http://www.co.washington.mn.us/info_for_residents/survey_and_land_management_division/survey_unit/metadata_for_parcel_data/

The primary example of this is the condominium, though some counties stacked polygons for condos. Condominiums, by definition, are legally owned as individual, taxed real estate units. Records for condominiums may not show up in the polygon dataset. The points for the point dataset often will be randomly placed or stacked within the parcel polygon with which they are associated.
The polygon layer is broken into individual county shape files. The points layer is provided as both individual county files and as one file for the entire metro area.
In many places a one-to-one relationship does not exist between these parcel polygons or points and the actual buildings or occupancy units that lie within them. There may be many buildings on one parcel and there may be many occupancy units (e.g. apartments, stores or offices) within each building. polygons / points Anoka - 129385 / 129385 Carver - 38699 / 38699 Dakota - 136792 / 150666 Hennepin - 424702 / 424702 Ramsey - 148978 / 166846 Scott - 55227 / 55227 Washington - 106841 / 106841

Anoka = http://www.datafinder.org/metadata/anok_parcels.htm
Carver = http://www.datafinder.org/metadata/carv_parcels.htm
Dakota = http://www.datafinder.org/metadata/dako_parcels.htm
Hennepin = http://www.datafinder.org/metadata/henn_parcels.htm
Ramsey = http://www.datafinder.org/metadata/rams_parcelregions.htm

Washington = http://www.co.washington.mn.us/info_for_residents/survey_and_land_management_division/survey_unit/metadata_for_parcel_data/</abstract><purpose>To view, analyze and display parcel data anywhere in the seven county metro area.</purpose><supplinf>Twin Cities 7 County Metropolitan Area. This includes the counties of Anoka, Carver, Dakota, Hennepin, Ramsey, Scott and Washington in Minnesota.</supplinf></descript><timeperd><timeinfo><sngdate><caldate>20120125</caldate></sngdate></timeinfo><current>All data is current to the date stated in the Time Period section above unless otherwise noted.</current></timeperd><status><progress>Complete</progress><update>Quarterly</update></status><spdom><bounding><westbc>-94.012</westbc><eastbc>-92.732</eastbc><northbc>45.415</northbc><southbc>44.471</southbc></bounding></spdom><keywords><place><placekey>Twin Cities, Anoka County, Carver County, Dakota County, Hennepin County, Ramsey County, Scott County, Washington County</placekey></place><theme><themekey>parcels, regional parcel data, cadastre, land ownership</themekey><themekt>None</themekt></theme></keywords><accconst>Access to this Regional Parcel Dataset is restricted by licensing requirements imposed by the seven counties that supply the source data. Under these licensing requirements, this dataset is available through MetroGIS at no cost to organizations that qualify as ''Governmental '' or ''Academic'' interests.
''Governmental Interests'' means all local, regional, state and federal governmental jurisdictions, including their respective political subdivisions, in the United States.
''Academic Interests'' means an accredited college or university or any other institution of higher education in the United States.
Individuals and organizations, which do not qualify as governmental or academic interests, must contact the county(ies) directly for access. A license may be required and a fee will be assessed. Contact information can be found at http://www.metrogis.org/data/datasets/parcels/private/index.shtml .</accconst><useconst>See license agreements.</useconst><browse><browsen>http://www.datafinder.org/metadata/bg/metrogis_regional_parcels.jpg</browsen><browsed>Sample map showing the MetroGIS Regional Parcel Data.</browsed></browse><crossref><citeinfo><title>Various parcel datasets available at the MetroGIS DataFinder website at http://www.datafinder.org/catalog/index.asp#LandOwnership</title></citeinfo></crossref><native>See metadata for individual counties.</native><ptcontac><cntinfo><cntperp><cntper>SEE METADATA FOR INDIVIDUAL COUNTIES</cntper></cntperp><cntemail>jonathan.hoekenga@metc.state.mn.us</cntemail></cntinfo></ptcontac></idinfo><dataqual><attracc><attraccr>A standard set of attribute fields is included for each county. However, not all attributes are available for all counties. No attempt has been made by MetroGIS to assess the accuracy of the attribute data.
Additional or missing attributes may be available from local assessors.
Any questions or comments about suspected errors or omissions in this dataset can be addressed to the contact person listed in the individual county metadata. Links to that metadata can be found in the Horizontal Positional Accuracy element below.</attraccr></attracc><logic>No attempt was made to edgematch or rubbersheet the seven counties, thus overlaps and gaps will exist between counties. Not all tax parcels are represented by a unique polygon. For example, a county might have one polygon representing a condominium complex. Some counties have provided an additional parcel points shape file that will include points to represent such tax parcels (e.g. a point for each individual condominium).</logic><complete>For parcel attributes, see Section 5 of this metadata. For parcel geography, see metadata for individual counties.
Any questions or comments about suspected errors or omissions in this dataset can be addressed to the contact person listed in the individual county metadata. Links to that metadata can be found in the Horizontal Positional Accuracy element below.
Inclusion of Condominiums in Polygon Dataset: Some counties include condominium information within their polygon dataset and others do not. Some information on this topic is shown below. Contact each county for further information.
Anoka: Individual condominiums are included within the polygon dataset by subdividing the larger, common area parcel polygon of the condos into smaller polygons. These smaller polygons do not represent the actual geography of the condominiums, but do lie within the larger condo parcel.
Carver, Hennepin and Scott Individual condominiums are included within the polygon dataset using stacked polygons with the same geography for each condominium tax parcel.
Dakota, Ramsey and Washington One polygon is included in the polygon dataset for the geography of the larger common area of a condominium building or complex. Individual condominium units are only represented in the points dataset.
Note: For Carver County, where a point represents a tax parcel that has multiple, noncontiguous polygons, a single point will be placed within one of the polygons.</complete><posacc><horizpa><horizpar>See the Data Quality section of the metadata for individual counties at the following links:
Anoka = http://www.datafinder.org/metadata/anok_parcels.htm#dataqual
Carver = http://www.datafinder.org/metadata/carv_parcels.htm#dataqual
Dakota = http://www.datafinder.org/metadata/dako_parcels.htm#dataqual
Hennepin = http://www.datafinder.org/metadata/henn_parcels.htm#dataqual
Ramsey = http://www.datafinder.org/metadata/rams_parcel_regions.htm#dataqual
Scott = http://www.datafinder.org/metadata/scot_parcels.htm#dataqual
Washington = http://www.datafinder.org/metadata/wash_parcels.htm#dataqual</horizpar></horizpa></posacc><lineage><procstep><procdesc>Each county provided parcel polygons and points with attributes in shape file format with UTM coordinates, to the Metropolitan Council. The Metropolitan Council checked each shape file to insure it had the specified field names, types, lengths and order.
No attempt was made to edgematch or rubber sheet the parcel geography between counties.</procdesc></procstep><srcinfo><srcscale /></srcinfo></lineage></dataqual><spdoinfo><indspref>None</indspref><direct>Vector</direct><mgmg3obj>polygon shapes</mgmg3obj><mgmg3til>Polygons: One shape file for each of the seven counties. Points: One shape file for entire region.</mgmg3til></spdoinfo><eainfo><overview><eaover>A standard set of attribute fields is included for each county. The attributes are identical for the point and polygon datasets. Not all attributes fields are populated by each county.
A list of the attribute names is shown below. Detailed information about the attributes can be found at: http://www.datafinder.org/metadata/MetroGIS_Regional_Parcels_Attributes_2011.pdf
Field Name Brief Description Type Width ---------- -------------------------- ------- ---- COUNTY_ID Unique County ID text 3 PIN Unique Parcel ID text 17 BLDG_NUM House Number text 10 PREFIX_DIR Street Prefix Direction text 2 PREFIXTYPE Street Prefix Type text 6 STREETNAME Street Name text 40 STREETTYPE Street Type text 4 SUFFIX_DIR Street Suffix Direction text 2 UNIT_INFO Unit Information text 12 CITY City (actual) text 30 CITY_USPS City (mailing) text 30 ZIP ZIP Code text 5 ZIP4 ZIP 4 Extension text 4 PLAT_NAME Legal Description Plat Name text 50 BLOCK Legal Description Block text 5 LOT Legal Description Lot text 5 ACRES_POLY Polygon Acreage numeric 11 (2 dec) ACRES_DEED Deeded Acreage numeric 11 (2 dec) USE1_DESC Use Type 1 text 100 USE2_DESC Use Type 2 text 100 USE3_DESC Use Type 3 text 100 USE4_DESC Use Type 4 text 100 MULTI_USES Multiple Uses text 1 LANDMARK Landmark/Business Name text 100 OWNER_NAME Owner Name text 50 OWNER_MORE Additional Owner Name text 50 OWN_ADD_L1 Owner Address Line 1 text 40 OWN_ADD_L2 Owner Address Line 2 text 40 OWN_ADD_L3 Owner Address Line 3 text 40 TAX_NAME Taxpayer Name text 40 TAX_ADD_L1 Taxpayer Address Line 1 text 40 TAX_ADD_L2 Taxpayer Address Line 2 text 40 TAX_ADD_L3 Taxpayer Address Line 3 text 40 HOMESTEAD Homestead Status text 1 EMV_LAND Est. Market Value - Land numeric 11 EMV_BLDG Est. Market Value - Buildings numeric 11 EMV_TOTAL Est. Market Value - Total numeric 11 TAX_CAPAC Tax Capacity numeric 11 TOTAL_TAX Total Tax numeric 11 SPEC_ASSES Special Assessments numeric 11 TAX_EXEMPT Tax Exempt Status text 1 XUSE1_DESC Exempt Use 1 text 100 XUSE2_DESC Exempt Use 2 text 100 XUSE3_DESC Exempt Use 3 text 100 XUSE4_DESC Exempt Use 4 text 100 DWELL_TYPE Dwelling Type text 30 HOME_STYLE Home Style text 30 FIN_SQ_FT Square Footage numeric 11 GARAGE Garage text 1 GARAGESQFT Garage Square Footage text 11 BASEMENT Basement text 1 HEATING Heating text 30 COOLING Cooling text 30 YEAR_BUILT Year Built numeric 4 NUM_UNITS Number of Units text 6 SALE_DATE Last Sales Date date 8 SALE_VALUE Last Sales Value numeric 11 SCHOOL_DST School District text 6 WSHD_DIST Watershed District text 50 GREEN_ACRE Green Acres text 1 OPEN_SPACE Open Space text 1 AG_PRESERV Agricultural Preserve text 1 AGPRE_ENRD Ag. Preserve Enrolled date 8 AGPRE_EXPD Ag. Preserve Expiration date 8 PARC_CODE Parcel Polygon to Parcel Point and PIN Relationship Code numeric 2</eaover><eadetcit>A detailed description of the attributes available in this dataset can be found at http://www.datafinder.org/metadata/MetroGIS_Regional_Parcels_Attributes_2011.pdf
Note: The last five digits of Dakota Counties PIN Numbers changed format in March of 2011 See .pdf above for further details.
A lookup table "ParcelsDakotaOldNewPINLookupTable2011.dbf" will be included in the Dakota County zip bundle that allows users to join parcel information which contain the old PIN format. Users should be aware that the old and new PIN formats are not mutually exclusive to each other. There are approximately 1,500 records of NEWPIN numbers that have the same PIN as OLDPIN number. </eadetcit></overview></eainfo><distinfo><resdesc>MetroGIS Regional Parcel dataset</resdesc><distliab>See license agreement.</distliab><stdorder><digform><digtinfo><formname>Shapefile</formname><formvern>ArcGIS: 10x</formvern><transize>Varies by county</transize></digtinfo></digform><ordering>LICENSING This is a licensed dataset. The licensing and data acquisition procedures differ depending upon the type of organization requesting the datasets.
Qualifying governmental units and academic interests may obtain the dataset without fee directly from MetroGIS. More information about licensing for these organizations can be found at http://www.metrogis.org/data/datasets/parcels/public/index.shtml .
All other organizations and individuals must obtain the dataset directly from each county. In most cases a fee is required. More information about licensing and acquisition procedures can be found at http://www.metrogis.org/data/datasets/parcels/private/index.shtml .
DOWNLOADING Licensed governmental and academic users may download the parcel dataset using the userID, password and instructions provided with their license approval. The dataset is downloaded from a password protected FTP site.</ordering></stdorder><distrib><cntinfo><cntperp><cntorg>Metropolitan Council, on behalf of MetroGIS</cntorg><cntper>Jon Hoekenga</cntper></cntperp><cntpos>GIS Specialist</cntpos><cntaddr><address>390 Robert Street North</address><city>St. Paul</city><state>Minnesota</state><postal>55101-1805</postal></cntaddr><cntvoice>651-602-1561</cntvoice><cntfax>651-602-1674</cntfax><cntemail>jonathan.hoekenga@metc.state.mn.us</cntemail></cntinfo></distrib></distinfo><metainfo><metd>20120719</metd><metstdn>Minnesota Geographic Metadata Guidelines</metstdn><metstdv>1.2</metstdv><metextns><onlink>http://www.gis.state.mn.us/stds/metadata.htm</onlink></metextns><metc><cntinfo><cntperp><cntorg>Metropolitan Council</cntorg><cntper>Jon Hoekenga</cntper></cntperp><cntpos>GIS GIS Specialist</cntpos><cntaddr><address>390 Robert Street North</address><city>St. Paul</city><state>Minnesota</state><postal>55101-1805</postal></cntaddr><cntvoice>651-602-1561</cntvoice><cntfax>651-602-1674</cntfax><cntemail>jonathan.hoekenga@metc.state.mn.us</cntemail></cntinfo></metc></metainfo><Esri><ModDate>20110802</ModDate><ModTime>08265000</ModTime></Esri><mdDateSt Sync="TRUE">20110802</mdDateSt><spref><horizsys><planar><gridsys><gridsysn>Universal Transverse Mercator</gridsysn><utm><utmzone>15</utmzone></utm></gridsys><planci><plandu>meters</plandu></planci></planar><geodetic><horizdn>NAD83</horizdn><ellips>GRS80</ellips></geodetic></horizsys></spref></metadata>
